FuncDef:
The transmission-alarm down command customizes alarms globally in the AP view on a 10GE WAN interface, that is, specifies which alarms cause the interface to go Down.
The undo transmission-alarmdown command disables the alarm customization globally in the to an AP on a 10GE WAN interface.
By default, only the LRDI, PAIS, PRDI, LAIS, LOF, and LOS alarms are enabled globally for a 10GE WAN interface.
CLIs: transmission-alarm down wan { los | lof | lais | oof | lrdi | lcd | auais | b3tca | lom | lop | lrei | pais | prdi | prei | pplm | puneq | rdool | rrool | sdbere | sfbere | trool | b1tca | b2tca } *

undo transmission-alarm down wan [ los | lof | lais | oof | lrdi | lcd | auais | b3tca | lom | lop | lrei | pais | prdi | prei | pplm | puneq | rdool | rrool | sdbere | sfbere | trool | b1tca | b2tca ] *

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The frequent generation of alarms causes the physical status of an interface to continuously alternate between Up and Down and continuous network flapping. To customize alarms for 10GE WAN interfaces globally, run the transmission-alarm down command. This configuration specifies alarms that can cause a physical interface to go Down.
Configuration Impact
Configuration of this command in the AP view of a master device takes effect globally on the following types of interfaces: 10GE WAN interface.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
By default, the LAIS, LOF, and LOS alarms can change the interface status. If these types of alarms are disabled, service data cannot be forwarded correctly.After the transmission-alarm down command is run, a 10GE WAN interface in the virtual access AP-ID view goes Down only when the specified alarm is generated, and the previous configuration performed through this command is deleted.After the undo transmission-alarm down command is run, the specific alarm generated does not cause a 10GE WAN interface in the virtual access AP-ID view globally to go Down.When alarms are customized globally in the AP view, if the non-default customization is configured on the interface, the customization configured on the interface takes effect. If the default customization is configured on the interface, the global configuration takes effect.WLNK alarms can be viewed only and cannot be configured by using this command. The WLNK alarms are always enabled and can cause the physical status of interfaces to go Down. You can run the display transmission-alarm command to view the status and statistics on the alarms.
